rules.natural: Whenever a research team discovered a medicinal plant, a drug formula was patented by a patent office.
If a research team discovered a medicinal plant, then it is not the case that the research team was awarded an innovation prize.
Either a research team discovered a medicinal plant or a side effect was toxic to human subjects.
A technology was licensed to a biotech firm, or if a research team discovered a medicinal plant, then the research team was awarded an innovation prize.
If an active compound was synthesized in a laboratory, then a scientific paper was published in a research journal.
Whenever a drug formula was patented by a patent office, an active compound was synthesized in a laboratory.
Under the condition that a research project was funded by a grant provider, a drug product was marketed in a healthcare market.
A research project was funded by a grant provider, or an academic institution partnered with a pharma company.
If an academic institution partnered with a pharma company, then if a research team discovered a medicinal plant, a scientific paper was published in a research journal.
Provided that a drug product was marketed in a healthcare market, a clinical trial was approved by a regulatory agency.

facts.natural: A technology was not licensed to a biotech firm.
A scientific paper was not published in a research journal.
A clinical trial was not approved by a regulatory agency.

target.natural: A side effect was toxic to human subjects.

If a research project was funded by a grant provider, then a clinical trial was approved by a regulatory agency.
A clinical trial was approved by a regulatory agency, or if a research team discovered a medicinal plant, then a scientific paper was published in a research journal.

A side effect was toxic to human subjects.

A side effect was toxic to human subjects.

(A1 → A2).natural: If a research team discovered a medicinal plant, then a scientific paper was published in a research journal.

(A1 → A3).natural: Provided that a research team discovered a medicinal plant, an active compound was synthesized in a laboratory.

(A1 → A4).natural: Whenever a research team discovered a medicinal plant, a drug formula was patented by a patent office.

(A1 → A9).natural: Under the condition that a research team discovered a medicinal plant, the research team was awarded an innovation prize.

(A1 → ¬A9).natural: If a research team discovered a medicinal plant, then it is not the case that the research team was awarded an innovation prize.

(A1 ∨ G).natural: Either a research team discovered a medicinal plant or a side effect was toxic to human subjects.

(A10 ∨ (A1 → A9)).natural: A technology was licensed to a biotech firm, or if a research team discovered a medicinal plant, then the research team was awarded an innovation prize.

(A3 → A2).natural: If an active compound was synthesized in a laboratory, then a scientific paper was published in a research journal.

(A4 → A3).natural: Whenever a drug formula was patented by a patent office, an active compound was synthesized in a laboratory.

(A5 ∨ (A1 → A2)).natural: A clinical trial was approved by a regulatory agency, or if a research team discovered a medicinal plant, then a scientific paper was published in a research journal.

(A6 → A5).natural: If a research project was funded by a grant provider, then a clinical trial was approved by a regulatory agency.

(A6 → A8).natural: Under the condition that a research project was funded by a grant provider, a drug product was marketed in a healthcare market.

(A6 ∨ A7).natural: A research project was funded by a grant provider, or an academic institution partnered with a pharma company.

(A7 → (A1 → A2)).natural: If an academic institution partnered with a pharma company, then if a research team discovered a medicinal plant, a scientific paper was published in a research journal.

(A8 → A5).natural: Provided that a drug product was marketed in a healthcare market, a clinical trial was approved by a regulatory agency.

G.natural: A side effect was toxic to human subjects.

¬A1.natural: A research team did not discover a medicinal plant.

¬A10.natural: A technology was not licensed to a biotech firm.

¬A2.natural: A scientific paper was not published in a research journal.

¬A5.natural: A clinical trial was not approved by a regulatory agency.
